H0.text: Burrowing below the frost point of the soil surface is the most likely behavior used by the ground squirrels to survive winter temperatures that often reach –15 °C in the grasslands of the Great Plains.

H1.text: Burrowing in tree trunks above the soil surface is the most likely behavior ground squirrels use to survive the Great Plains grasslands winter temperatures that often reach ‑15 °C.

H2.text: Consuming roots found under the soil surface is the most likely behavior that a population of ground squirrels in the grasslands of the Great Plains uses to survive winter temperatures that often reach –15 °C.

H3.text: Consuming organisms found in the soil surface is the most likely behavior ground squirrels in the grasslands of the Great Plains use to survive winter temperatures that often reach -15 °C.
